content.description: Begin on a boulder near the left end and traverse right above a roof to large stances. The first gear placement is about 15' off the ground but the climbing difficulty through the initial section is moderate (5.10-). Continue upward past one bolt and a piton before reaching the sustained crux section using side pulls, protruding edges, and small crystals to a sloping ledge. A move over a bulge near the top leads to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Many small stoppers including brass and #00 - #3 TCU's provide adequate protection. One bolt (3/8") and a solid piton are also present. A two bolt (3/8") anchor is present on top of the rock.
content.location: This fine route ascends the middle section of the Safety First Rock through a series of discontinuous slanting seams on solid rock. The Safety First Rock is about 40' right of the Future Games formation.

content.description: Initially, make tenuous moves straight up to the end of a thin seam (difficult to protect) before stepping left and up to a bolt. Face climbing above the bolt leads to discontinuous right-slanting finger cracks. A flared hand crack exists for the final 10' to the top. Rappel from the two bolt anchor.
content.protection: The majority of this climb can be protected with small stoppers and 1/2 inch to 3 inch cams. One bolt (3/8") is present about 20' from the bottom. Two bolts (3/8") on top can be used for an anchor.
content.location: This varied and fun climb begins off of a boulder on the left end of the Safety First Rock (40' right of the Future Games formation).
